Imports

bio/data

Types

Sequence = ref object of RootObj
  chain*, class*: string
A generic object to store the chain of the Sequence (either nucleotides or aminoacids). 
SequenceRecord = ref object of RootObj
  name*: string
  record*: Sequence
An intermediate construct to hold a Sequence while naming it. 
Dna = ref object of Sequence
Rna = ref object of Sequence
Protein = ref object of Sequence

Procs

proc initDna(chain: string): Dna {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Initializes a new Dna object

Examples:

let dna: Dna = initDna("TGCACCCCA")
proc initRna(chain: string): Rna {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Initializes a new Rna object

Examples:

let rna: Rna = initRna("ACGUGGGGU")
proc initProtein(chain: string): Protein {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Initializes a new Protein object

Examples:

let protein: Protein = initProtein("TWG")
proc `$`(s: Sequence): string {...}{.raises: [ValueError], tags: [].}

Sequence representation is limited to "Class + 60 chars" of sequence.

If you need the whole sequence, access Sequence.chain directly

Examples:

let rna: Rna = initRna("ACGUGGGGU")
doAssert $rna == "RNA: ACGUGGGGU"

Examples:

import
  strutils

let rna: Rna = initRna("ACGUGGGGU".repeat(10))
doAssert $rna ==
    "RNA: ACGUGGGGUACGUGGGGUACGUGGGGUACGUGGGGUACGUGGGGUACGUGGGGUACGUGG…"
proc `?=`(a, b: Sequence): bool {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Compare two sequences. true if both class and chain are the same.

Examples:

doAssert initDna("AAACGGG") ?= Sequence(chain: "AAACGGG", class: "DNA")
doAssert (initDna("AAACGGG") ?= initRna("AAACGGG")) == false
proc write(record: SequenceRecord; fHandler: File; kind: string = "fasta") {...}{.
    raises: [IOError], tags: [WriteIOEffect].}

Write a SequenceRecord to fHandler, wrapping the sequence by 60 positions. The name of the SequenceRecord remains untouched.

TBD: kind is a string as in "fasta", to support different formats. Right now only FASTA files are supported.

To write a FASTA file myOutput.fasta with the contents:

>My DNA sequence
TGCACCCCA

use the following:

Examples:

let fastaOut = open("myOutput.fasta", fmWrite)
let mySeq = initDna("TGCACCCCA")
let myRec = SequenceRecord(name: "My DNA sequence", record: mySeq)
myRec.write(fastaOut)
proc write(record: SequenceRecord; fName, kind: string = "fasta") {...}{.raises: [IOError],
    tags: [WriteIOEffect].}
Same as write-through-handler proc but you only need to point out the name of the file.

Examples:

let mySeq = initDna("TGCACCCCA")
let myRec = SequenceRecord(name: "My DNA sequence", record: mySeq)
myRec.write("myOutput.fasta")
proc complement(dna: Dna): Dna {...}{.raises: [KeyError], tags: [].}
Return a new Dna object with the complement sequence.

Examples:

doAssert initDna("TGCACCCCA").complement.chain == "ACGTGGGGT"
proc reverseComplement(dna: Dna): Dna {...}{.raises: [KeyError], tags: [].}
Return a new Dna object with the reverse complement sequence.

Examples:

doAssert initDna("ACGTGGGGT").reverseComplement.chain == "ACCCCACGT"
proc transcript(dna: Dna): Rna {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Return a new Rna object with the transcribed sequence.

Examples:

doAssert initDna("ACGTGGGGT").transcript.chain == "ACGUGGGGU"
proc translate(dna: Dna): Protein {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}

Return a new Protein object with the translated sequence.

In-frame deletions are translated as -, out-of-frame deletions as X, stop codons as *.

Examples:

doAssert initDna("ACGTGGGGT").translate.chain == "TWG"
doAssert initDna("ACGT--GGGGT").translate.chain == "TXGX"
doAssert initDna("ACGTAAGGGGT").translate.chain == "T*GX"
proc complement(rna: Rna): Rna {...}{.raises: [KeyError], tags: [].}
Return a new Rna object with the complement sequence.

Examples:

doAssert initRna("ACGUGGGGU").complement.chain == "UGCACCCCA"
proc reverseComplement(rna: Rna): Rna {...}{.raises: [KeyError], tags: [].}
Return a new Rna object with the reverse complement sequence.

Examples:

doAssert initRna("ACGUGGGGU").reverseComplement.chain == "ACCCCACGU"
proc backTranscribe(rna: Rna): Dna {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Return a new Dna object with the sequence transcribed from RNA.

Examples:

doAssert initRna("ACGUGGGGU").backTranscribe.chain == "ACGTGGGGT"
proc translate(rna: Rna): Protein {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Return a new Protein object with the translated sequence.

Examples:

doAssert initRna("ACGUGGGGU").translate.chain == "TWG"
